website_summaries.verdict: If you're in love with the idea of a Wi-Fi-connected multicooker, the Instant Pot Smart WiFi cooks well and brings you those internet-enabled extras. Otherwise, you'll do just as well with a more affordable Instant Pot model.
pros: The Instant Pot Smart WiFi sends mobile notifications when cooking is complete, and you can see the status of your food from anywhere through the Instant Pot app
cons: Adding Wi-Fi doesn't give you integration with any voice assistants or other smart home products
You can't actually change a cooking mode in the app once it's started cooking and there's no numerical temperature reading

customer_reviews.title: You are required to share your personal information if you want to use WiFi
customer_reviews.text: If you want to connect this to WiFi you are required to signup for an account and agree to the terms of services and privacy policy. Sorry but you don't need my personal information to make WiFi services work!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: App works, but Big Brother is watching!
customer_reviews.text: Installed the app with no issues. Limited Functionality. While Pressure Cooking I am able to see the minutes remaining. I can also cancel cooking (not sure why I need that on the app). It also provided basic setting information (Pressure - High, Adjust - Normal). What I did not like is that I had to register through the company web site in order to connect to my device! Really?? Can I just cook without having to send everything i am doing into cyberspace? I am deleting the app. Maybe they will change the policy in future releases.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Does not connect to wifi
customer_reviews.text: The main reason to buy this is to connect with phone using wifi. The app does not work at all. I called tech support twice, long hold time and after 3 call transfer I was able to talk to a novice tech support. He had no idea how to trouble shoot this & could not help me to connect Instant Pot with wifi with 2 different phones. He said it is a very new product and don't have any answers or FAQ for the android app. What is the point buying this high end product. He said in few weeks the app will be updated but till then only use like a regular pot?? Really.
customer_reviews.author: S P

customer_reviews.title: Not accessible for the blind!
customer_reviews.text: App problems! When using the iPhone app with voice over i’m unable to use all the options. I would hope insta pot will test for accessibility. If they won’t make inprovements i will be forced to return the wifi smart pot.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Buy anything else
customer_reviews.text: The app is unusable trash, even if it did work. Don’t bother with the smart WiFi model.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Everyone needs one of these!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS PRODUCT. I've been finding myself telling everyone and anyone that they need this instant pot. This had simplified my life so much and also has allowed me to make things I never would have made on my own. I've made tamales, purple rice, ramen, Pho, Tikka masala, French onion soup, sourdough bread, fish, honestly the list goes on and on. I bought one for my mother after mine arrived and she has stopped using her oven/stovetop all together. The speed is incredible, I'm so blown away.
customer_reviews.author: Paige Emmrich

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY FROM AMAZON. MAY BE USED.
customer_reviews.text: GROSS -it didn’t come with the condensation cup (the second step in the set up) AND when I opened it there was a piece of some leaf (cilantro or something) attached to the lid.
customer_reviews.author: laurones

customer_reviews.title: Shipped without a cord!!
customer_reviews.text: Received my pot yesterday. Excitedly I went out and picked up a roast today. Roast rubbed and ready to cook... I unpacked the instant pot, checked out all the cool gadgets, washed the inner pot and ready to start my meal. Went to plug it in... no cord!! What? Who doesn’t include the cord? Went out to the trash, pulled box out and verified the cord is not in the box. I have and instant pot but can’t cook in it. Beyond irritated right now. Can’t even review the machine because I cannot use it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Odden

customer_reviews.title: Wifi dead in a few months
customer_reviews.text: Work great. I like the wifi feature. However, the wifi stopped working. Tried all the method but still not working. Reset every thing and event creating a new instant pot account to wifi pair fresh but no luck. Without wifi, is is not what I was purchasing for. I would not recommend this if you want to wifi feature.
customer_reviews.author: Kimour Chi

customer_reviews.title: Just get a regular pressure cooker
customer_reviews.text: By far the worst product I've ever purchased. The settings are not at all easy to sync with my phone. And not at all easy to just start cooking alone. I have many cooking devices and tools and this is definately not user friendly. I've looked up many videos on "how to..." and nothing helps. It stays on "keep warm" and will not start cooking. I'm about to throw it out the window if I didnt pay so much for it what a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: kriiiiiiiis

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my hubby, broke the moment he plugged it in, made a sizzle type sound and a pop. Contacted the company, sent them all the information they asked for, BUT that wasn't enough. They need more pictures, more information, have me jumping through hoops to get a replacement, I have better things to do. I'm disappointed, I was told this pot is pretty nice, to bad the customer service sucks! The amount of info they require is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Small

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy
customer_reviews.text: The instant pot works as a pressure cooker, but that’s where it ends. DO NOT spend the extra money for the connected model, it does not connect. The app is the worst I’ve ever seen! I could kick myself for not buying the Costco model, I would’ve save myself some money!
customer_reviews.author: Yellowspoke

customer_reviews.title: For the foodie that's also a techie
customer_reviews.text: There might be cheaper pressure cookers, but this is the one to get if you want to control your pressure cooker with a phone app. Did I pay a $50 premium to use my phone to start cooking? Yes. Yes I did. But the best thing about the instant pot is the sauté feature, which allows me to brown meat and sauté onions straight in the pot, which also allows it to get up to pressure temp faster. And since I love cooking and braising meats that usually take hours on the stove, this one is a huge time saver.
customer_reviews.author: Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Just Getting Started
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for a few months now and have used it for some wonderful meals. But we have yet to really explore the capabilities of this device. Personally, I love asking for a recipe using my Google Home Hub and have it sent directly to the Instant Pot. Just add the ingredients and go.
customer_reviews.author: t2kburl

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!
customer_reviews.text: We love our new toy :). We connected our two new IP to the WiFi without any issue in the first try. Pros: - Versatile. It can do a lot! - Smart (you will get notifications and control in your phone) Cons: - Lid not full plastic covered. You can get burn. - Power cable to short. - It doesn’t seen that strong as my old Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Haven't received replacement... :(
customer_reviews.text: Process for establishing wifi connection is problematic. Attempting to synch to my pixel 2 Android phone is not working and there is no override that would allow me to manually establish wifi settings. I sent my unit back to get vende, they said they would be sending me a replacement unit but it has been months and I still don't have the replacement. Time to refund me and call this done.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Wilson

customer_reviews.title: deffective
customer_reviews.text: after 2 weeks of use, my Instant pot is not warming any more in any of his functions. The wifi connection was never working despite a 2,4 ghz connection.. the Amazon seller does not organize a return after one month delivery and the manufacturer warranty does not apply either on Instantpot.com. Nobody is taking responsibility for the deffective item. A total waste of money
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS F.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy the WiFi model
customer_reviews.text: InstaPots are good cookers, but don't get the WiFi model. It is a waste of money for little advantage and if, like mine, refuses to connect, an absolutely useless feature. Support, when you can actually speak with a person, is unable to help in any meaningful way. Get model other than this one.
customer_reviews.author: spiritracker

customer_reviews.title: Cooks fast cooks good
customer_reviews.text: I love my instant pot. It cooks beans in under 20 minutes and I can make a rack of baby backs from raw to crispy in under 30 minutes. I wish I would have gone with the bigger version since I like to entertain. But this size is perfect for about 3-4 people. The WiFi feature is not what I expected at all and that would be the only drawback to this version of the instant pot.
customer_reviews.author: Raul

customer_reviews.title: My apologies, gave this 1-star rating before ... it's 5 stars now
customer_reviews.text: I read the instructions but did so hurriedly, and that oversights that caused me frustrations. To make a long story short, it works well now. My apologies to the product manufacturer and vendor for my initial one-star rating. One has to initially connect the cooker to WiFi (by following the instructions in the manual), and once that's done, the moment you plug in the cooker, it is automatically already in standby mode and is ready to communicate with the app (that you can download from the app store). Just leave it in that mode and control it from the app from anywhere from thereon. Again, my apologies for the initial bad review, it's really good.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonBuyer

customer_reviews.title: very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Error C6 after according to a month of use. It's a bad pressure sensor. The device is therefore unusable. Do not recommend this product. Also, be aware of the product's limited warranty, which only applies in the United States and Canada. This information was never specified during the order. I ordered this product in December 2018 and Amazon delivered it to me without any problem in the French West Indies. I paid more for shipping than for product. Unfortunately 30 days later it does not work anymore, so it's a great product. Not living in the coverage area, so I can not do anything. This is scam because today, coincidentally, Amazon no longer delivers my geographical area.
customer_reviews.author: fa972

customer_reviews.title: I had high hopes ... but
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had the Instant Pot Duo for some time now. after I dropped and dented it, my dog got ahold of the valve and then I melted the handle on the stove, I decided to buy a new one. I’m a tech geek, so I bought the WiFi model. Set up was pretty easy but the valve is really touchy. It doesn’t really work unless I stand over it (hello, no benefits to WiFi). Then, I se up first meal. Chicken noodle soup. I used a recipe in the app - tried to cook and it said it wasn’t connected. Fail. Couldn’t get it connected. I’ll keep trying but you might want to stick with a basic model.
customer_reviews.author: Karen G

customer_reviews.title: Stupid App is not Smart
customer_reviews.text: The pressure cooker does an adequate job, but there are plenty of electric pressure cookers that cost less & easier to operate. The Smart WiFi app is a joke. The whole pairing process and account setup is so invasive, and quite frankly annoying. I was able to connect the device to my Apple iPhone just one time and then never again. It disconnects repeatedly. This Instapot Smart WiFi is STUPID.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff HathawayTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great one pot cooker
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful versatile pot. Wish I had gotten this sooner instead of separate pressure cooker and crock pot. App is great addition. You can start and control your pot from your mobile device and get notifications when it’s done. Plus the app has hundreds of recipes and you only need to press a button to start the pot. The app presets the pot based on the recipe for you.
customer_reviews.author: Chevy

customer_reviews.title: My favorite kitchen appliance
customer_reviews.text: I've cooked everything from fish to spaghetti in this pot and everything turns out great and it's fast. 3 lb. roast only takes about 2 hours and if you get a good quality roast it is as tender as if you had slow cooked it all day. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Allen

customer_reviews.title: Weefee? Sure.
customer_reviews.text: My first IP. Full disclosure, I bought this version only because Amazon Warehouse sold a like-new one for $65. Would def not pay $150 for it vs. Duo series. But anyhow, I'm super impressed with how versatile an IP can be. Been cooking since way more often. Rice, stew, ribs, steamed veggies etc. I might've gained some weight. I do wish the trivet was a little taller, and the lid easier to close.
customer_reviews.author: Linh Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Not able to connect/App doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in March 2019, it worked great but now the WiFi connection doesn't work, support from the manufacture is poor. The pot works other than that but I bought it because I was able to use it remotely and now that function doesn't work so I am very disappointed. I recommend you buy the regular/standard pot since the WiFi connectivity is useless; it DOESN'T WORK. Waste of money...
customer_reviews.author: MasielJason

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as promised!
customer_reviews.text: I am returning this product as the WiFi DOES NOT connect to it. I’m told it is a very common. Problem with them. Save your $$$ and buy one without the Bluetooth! I am returning it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: So far I like it I used it a couple of times so far.I did a beef stew on high pressure in 20 minutes came out perfect plus I did a chicken soup which I liked.you install an app on your phone which works with the pressure cooker so you can keep an I on your food when your not home.you can even start it with your phone if you want using your home wifi or stop it if there's a problem.the app has recipes you can try that's where I got the chicken soup from.
customer_reviews.author: richard metzler

customer_reviews.title: GAME CHANGER
customer_reviews.text: First of all I love it. I named it David Bowie... because he's under pressure. This thing made fall off the bone lamb stew in 35 minutes. AMAZING. Also all I had to clean at the end of this glorious meal was the inner pot, the cutting board, knife and my
customer_reviews.author: Alejandra Balen

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service was fast and friendly
customer_reviews.text: Wifi version wouldn't connect. We called customer service, around 10 am on a Friday. They picked up quickly and were helpful. They told us to hold down the "pressure level" button for about 10 seconds until you hear one long beep. This is like a hard reset. It immediately connected following the steps afterwards Very happy with the product so far.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: No temperature readout.
customer_reviews.text: I have just set up and tested my smart pot. It took several tries to get it to connect to wifi. The thing that shocked me is the fact that there is no digital readout of temperature. You actually have to open the pot and check the temperature with a manual thermometer. I can’t imagine why they wouldn’t have included that feature since it would be so easy to add it. All you get is a cartoon thermometer, with no calibrations, showing a red line that goes up and down with temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Ron W.

customer_reviews.title: WiFi setup isn't intuitive
customer_reviews.text: The WiFi setup isn't intuitive, and Instant Pot currently has two apps on the iOS App Store, only one of which connects to this appliance. That said, once you figure out which app you want (Remote Control for Smart WiFi) and follow any necessary troubleshooting steps on the Instant Pot website, it's a breeze to actually use. I've never been able to get good results with manual pressure cookers—operator error, I'm sure—but the Instant Pot makes pressure cooking super easy.
customer_reviews.author: K.L.

customer_reviews.title: WiFi setup was a breeze
customer_reviews.text: There have been some negative reviews on the WiFi setup. Let me set it straight...Took a whole 5 minutes to setup. Love the ability to program remotely. The layout of the presets is perfect. Like the ability to use as a slow cooker and both pressurized and unpressurized modes. The app has lots of recipes and never loses connection with the device.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni Stefani

customer_reviews.title: It wont pair, don't buy it!!
customer_reviews.text: It wont pair to my phone, or my wife's phone. Without the wifi and app capability this is pretty much a regular cooker with a fancy high tech looking display. Lame!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Garibay

customer_reviews.title: WiFi app is very limited, pressure vessel has an outward edge which makes it difficult to manipulate
customer_reviews.text: Good: stainless steel pot Bad: does not come with smaller containers to put inside main pot, plastic parts, hard to clean surfaces, bulky design, ugly blue lcd display Ugly: steel pressure vessel has protruding edge so it's difficult to hold it via gripper to pull it out, plastic low grade venting system that is very loose, not clear instructions on venting, dangerous venting that can release right into the face, wifi app is extremely rudimentary and limited does not allow adjustment of pressure on the fly, programming of new functions, no hyperlinks work, power off not feasible through wifi app
customer_reviews.author: MITSCIENTIST

customer_reviews.title: No Point
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for app connectivity which worked once and would never connect again. The recipes in the app leave out parts of the recipe and you have to read comments to figure out how others made the recipe work. Sent back as it was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Dale McGlamery

customer_reviews.title: most useless thing - hate it
customer_reviews.text: First, I never received all the parts. So I just figured out there is a white cop that attaches which collects water, it wasnt provided with it. so whole counter top is filled with water. 2. its not building pressure. Thats what its supposed to do in pressure cooker mode. 3. Very noisy. 4. Tried contacting the support people and they havent addressed problem as yet. replaced it or sent the parts that should have come with it originally. 5. I would give it zero stars if that was an option.
customer_reviews.author: sk

customer_reviews.title: Very user friendly
customer_reviews.text: I was a little nervous about getting an instant pot simply because I was nervous about how to work it. Overall It is very user friendly and the instruction book was easy to understand. I had it set up and ready to go in not time. My favorite thing about this instant pot is the Bluetooth feature and Alexa connect. I am able to let my instant pot cook and while focusing my attention on something else, I can check the status via bluetooth or through Alexa. The cleaning process is also very simple and the pot is easy to remove. I don't know how I ever lived without an instant pot!
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle

customer_reviews.title: Good unit, but no connection for WiFi
customer_reviews.text: So I replaced my previous InstaPot with this model. Works well, and I even made a cake. I choose this new model for WiFi monitor. No matter how many times I try to pair to it, there is always some problem. Can't find my network; Found my network but could not pair; Could not set my Key... Always something that stopped me from the WiFi.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gorecki

customer_reviews.title: Best choice for forgetful cooks
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted an instant pot for over a year, and finally decided it was time. The wifi version has been worth every penny. The phone updates on what's going on have made me so much more willing to cook, knowing I wont forget my food and overcook it, or forget there next step. And because it's wifi and not Bluetooth, it doesn't drain my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley

customer_reviews.title: The WIFI option sucks, go with the one compatible with air frying
customer_reviews.text: Awesome appliance to own, but go with the air frying option. This wifi capability is useless for what it does: you have to use the pre-set recipes only for it to work, when it works...
customer_reviews.author: andrescolombia

customer_reviews.title: Don’t really need the WiFi
customer_reviews.text: Cooks super fast Takes some getting used too on how to use had to watch some YouTube videos directions are not good Wish I wouldn’t have bought the smart one I don’t care for the WiFi it cooks so fast you really never leave it un attended couldn’t even connect it because it needs the WiFi to run a specific way to connect so I just didn’t bother
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD TREJO

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice High Quality
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It cooked the rice perfectly, and it was easy and fast. The only improvement would be to include recipes. I am haven't cooked using a pressure cooker since my childhood helping my mother. Later...I found the recipes on an app in the play store which is BETTER than including recipes. I eat mostly non dairy which a good portion of the recipes support.
customer_reviews.author: Dudette

customer_reviews.title: Wi-Fi feature not reliable.  App often does not detect device
customer_reviews.text: The actual cooker works great. Works as advertised. My main issue is that I bought this particular feature for the “smart” feature, which isn’t very smart at all. It is very aggravating having spend a good chunk of your time trying to setup a device that you bought for the convenience factor. More often than not, the app does not detect the device. And when it does, it seems pretty random. For the record, I am pretty comfortable with technology so that’s not the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Pressure Cooker Vs Slow cooker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a slow cooker and pressure cooker as I like to start stuff in the AM and slow cook. The pressure cooker is fine but as a slow cooker it does not do well. It basically warms stuff, not hot enough to cook , even on the high setting. A little deceptive in the advertising, but this is a great small pressure cooker.
customer_reviews.author: Mary N Watson

customer_reviews.title: Great pressure cooker, but WiFi is lacking
customer_reviews.text: I love this as a pressure cooker. I got the WiFi so I could start cooking while at work. Problem is, this doesn't allow you to start cooking via the app, only allows you to stop cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Fossum

customer_reviews.title: WiFi Makes it Less Fun
customer_reviews.text: Pro - lots of great pressure cooker settings. This thing is great for rice or a roast. Con - the wifi app is both a challenge to set up and less useful than that app that lets you fake drinking a beer (the app is a WiFi connected timer but every smartphone has a timer already). Tip - just get the Instant Pot without WiFi. It will save you $20, a lot of headache (from setting up WiFi each time you use it) and it comes with more settings (ooooo! MORE!)
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Overall good product works well. Could never get the WiFi function to work after much effort by IT.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: The WiFi model is a waste of time. I couldn’t get it to set up. It kept saying I had the wrong password, but I did not. Calling support is a exercise in waiting on hold, just to be hung up on. If you want a pressure cooker look for a brand that works and has a support system. This is not that product or company.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product.  Heartily recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I have made the absolute best chicken noodle soup and taco soup in this thing. Tastes like I've been cooking all day when I haven't. I find it indispensable for a busy lifestyle. I would happily buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Slushpuppy154

customer_reviews.title: Not as impressive as I'd hoped
customer_reviews.text: WiFi was hard to set up - didn't work as expected and the tech support had very limited hours. When I did get in touch it took her several tried and 30 minutes to get it set up. I tried a couple of recipes and found that food stuck whether on pressure cook or slow cook. It seemed like it would have been just as easy to cook stovetop and/or in the oven. I really want to love it but. . .
customer_reviews.author: Lila

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I hate cooking, but love my instant pot. Chili in minutes. No fail rice. Super easy instructions. Mostly putting food into the pot and hitting a button. The smart cooker is great because the app has recipes and in those recipes are buttons to use to tell your pot to start cooking. You don't have to sit and figure the settings on the pot. Just follow the recipe and click the cook button. Also alerts you when food is ready.
customer_reviews.author: robyn

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted a year.
customer_reviews.text: Owned it 13months and its not working. Doesnt turn on no indication its getting power. Tried plugging into other outlets, didn't help, made sure the chord was snug on the back of the pot, didn't help. Tried the chord itself on another appliance and it was fine, so it's the pot itself. Was great up until this point, got decent amount of use for it, but sucks that it only lasts a year.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Updated and edited review of the Instant Pot.
customer_reviews.text: My earlier review of the Instant Pot was premature and written prior to spending several hours trying (unsuccessfully) to pair the pot to a I-phone 6 plus. The App loaded to the phone but it is useless because it will not pair to the pot. "Smart" pot ???
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Best thing
customer_reviews.text: My mom used a Mirro pressure cooker for years, wore two or three out. So pressure cooker food, well I’m meh! But this cooker changed that. I haven’t had much time to use it, except in one or two dishes, but it’s a wonderful item. Our apartment (rental} provide a terrible cooking stove is reason enough to buy this. As we travel less we’ll use it more. I love the hundreds of free recipes available. It’s worth having.
customer_reviews.author: NetadminTop Contributor: Fountain Pens

customer_reviews.title: POS
customer_reviews.text: Thing drops from a standard 2.4GHZ all the time. The app is useless. Do yourself a favor and look at other pressure cookers.
customer_reviews.author: vrharley

customer_reviews.title: GAME CHANGER!
customer_reviews.text: I've waited all my adult life for something like this! My husband referred to it as a game-changer and he is 100% correct. We've used it just about every day since opening it. We even made the ham for new year's eve in it! It's the easiest product to use and clean plus the app tells you the status and alerts you to any changes or issues. Best buy of the year!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel O'Dell

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last year and have used it so many times! Love it! I don’t use any fancy functions though not the slow cooker function. Nothing has broken and the rubber ring inside is still usable (had to get new ones for yogurt making though). Tricky cleaning the rim but I wedge a chlorine wipe down in there with a chopstick (working with what i have here!) and was able to clean it that way successfully without having to buy anything new.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sucks bad
customer_reviews.text: This thing doesn't fricken work. I've tried to make beans several times, but the thing cooks them too much, too little, and can just kiss my butt. I will return the thing asap. Don't waste your money on the stupid wifi version.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy Lovely

customer_reviews.title: Safe, high-quality, easy clean
customer_reviews.text: I cooked cabbage carrots and sausages in about 15 minutes under high pressure. The carrots were infused because they were under the cup of broth that I put in with the sausages. The cabbage was above. I loved the mix of flavors. The fresh cabbage with the sausages and carrots. I cannot wait to try making homemade chili and cooking other meats on this pressure cooker.
customer_reviews.author: Ray ”Rip” VanRiper

customer_reviews.title: The wifi works great every time and is very useful.
customer_reviews.text: I do my Instant Pot cooking downstairs from my living area. I used to setup a camera to keep an eye on things. Now I just load up the pot, put the lid on and enter all the settings on my iPad or phone. The app will tell me when the pressure starts and ends and I can watch for burn warnings.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Needed to reset pot settings to connect to WiFi
customer_reviews.text: Works well as expected but failed to connect to WiFi out of the box. Needed to reset the pot settings before it could successfully connect to WiFi. To reset, press and hold Cancel for 10 seconds and then press and hold the WiFi On/Off button for 10 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Mareeta

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE the WiFi feature. One of the best things about the instant pot is being able to put the food in and walk away. Well now I can walk even farther away lol. I can go outside and not have to keep running in the house to check on the time left. I haven’t actually looked into the app or used the recipes on there. I’m just happy getting the notifications on my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Love the WIFI function.
customer_reviews.text: I love the WIFI function. I am a person who loves outdoor activities away from home. I am retired and do NOT adhere to any time schedule. So it is nice to be able to load up the pot or Pots (I own two of them) and remote start and monitor them. It is nice to come home to hot food waiting for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ken D.

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I love my instant pot. Easy to make lots of great dishes. Although the wifi is a bit of a gimmick I’d recommend saving your money and getting the regular one which is cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: 6ixReviews

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Replaces my crockpot. Things that used to take all day now take under an hour. And we don’t have to worry about leaving on a crockpot all day and the off chance we get off later than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Priss

customer_reviews.title: If you have the time to figure out and weight out food it’s great
customer_reviews.text: Reason I gave it four stars is because I have had it for months and used it 2 times figuring out this thing is not easy unless your cooking from one if there recipes in the app and be careful removing the lid the hot moisture from the steam builds up and it runs off the lid soon as you open it
customer_reviews.author: brock

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for after work dinners and weekend slow cook days
customer_reviews.text: Between the pressure cooker, sautéer, and regular cooker... I am in love. First thing I tried was making Mac and cheese and I couldn’t be happier with it. You have the option of quick release vs slow release after pressure cooking which is very helpful. Easy to clean and simple to story. One cord and WiFi comparable. Very grateful!
customer_reviews.author: Jen Gambuti

customer_reviews.title: Refuses to pressurize, despite adjusting lid and reassuring valve is set to sealing
customer_reviews.text: Bought this instantpot a year ago as a backup to my first instant pot. My first put still works but I needed both for the holidays. Welp, that was a major bust! Every time we try to use this one it refuses to pressurize then days did burn. No matter how many times you adjust it. I'm livid! Here I am out of my return period and this pot hasn't worked a single time.
customer_reviews.author: Shawonda Irons

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this instant pot, it’s a definitely a smart cooker. It tells you on your phone when your food need to be stirred and when it’s burning. A must have.
customer_reviews.author: MEbe

customer_reviews.title: Instant pot WiFi
customer_reviews.text: Enjoy not being in the same room with the instant pot. Communicates well. Made rice well. Bone soup well. Ribs turned out great.
customer_reviews.author: sobo13

customer_reviews.title: Convenient with caveats
customer_reviews.text: I’ve cooked several dishes in my instapot. I like that everything is in one container. I do wish there was a way to get an estimate of how long it would take to build up pressure. That can vary greatly. Releasing the pressure can be hazardous as well.
customer_reviews.author: B B

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this product!!! Strongly recommended!!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love it. I should have bought This since long time ago. Totally worth the money. I love it that I can use Wi-Fi control with my cell phone. The pressure function works really well and makes my life much easier without the need to stand in front of the stove for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Read all the hype so bought one as a present ( I don't cook) and it works well very practical. Most trimings are close to normal ovens and you have to be careful not to use to much moisture but quality of food and ease of preparation plus cleaning are excellent
customer_reviews.author: M D Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: 3 stars because I can’t get the pot to connect to WiFi. There’s also a steep learning curve to using the pot, but it’s great once you get used to it. Most functions work great, but I’m not impressed with the crockpot function. My spaghetti sauce was undercooked, so I’ll stick with my regular crockpot.
customer_reviews.author: Karin L.

customer_reviews.title: What a great gift!
customer_reviews.text: I just received my Instant Pot with wi-fi for Christmas and already love it. It is easy to use and clean. Tonight I made a chili and it was great being able to sauté right in the pot before adding the other ingredients. It was simple setting up the connection between the pot and my phone. I think I will really enjoy that feature when I need to start dinner before I get home.
customer_reviews.author: Misspatticake

customer_reviews.title: Great deal from Amazon ware house
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an IP that worked with Alexa. I found a set up video on Utube, so set up was easy. The only problem is some times Alexa gives error( IP not responding) Other than that it works great & I paid half the price thru the warehouse deal.
customer_reviews.author: some beach

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and convenient
customer_reviews.text: I made brown rice the other night and it was incredibly easy to make perfect brown rice and very fast. We have also made many other dishes and I’m very happy with the versatility of the product. I’m looking forward to making some yogurt.
customer_reviews.author: Starry

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 10 months
customer_reviews.text: I love my instant pot but after 10 months it stopped working. I have taken great care of it and it just stop working in the middle of cooking with no error message. Edit: I want to add that I was able to get a replacement free of charge. The manufacturer was very helpful and it was hassle free. I love using my instant pot!
customer_reviews.author: Maria B.

customer_reviews.title: The premium price would mean premium quality, right? Wrong
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it for 3 weeks and everything was nice and well done, but after then, nothing would work the same way. When it worked, it would cook something fast, but now that something isn't working, the same thing takes double the time. This is really inconvenient and I am definitely returning.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Completely in accessible to blind cooks
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Wi-Fi version of this phone app. I am blind and use talking screen reader program called voice over. The app is not accessible and I was unable to operate the pot at all. Very very disappointed. It’s hard to screw up an iPhone app,.
customer_reviews.author: DarkLordMark

customer_reviews.title: Very mad
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed. I bought this for my wife as a gift, which she opened TODAY. Out of the box it’s broken. Plastic pieces that are more cosmetic then functional then anything else, not worth the ridiculous exchange process. I’m very mad.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing purchase. My wife loves this thing. Bluetooth is a little wonky, but who cares - you may use that once or twice and then the new is worn off. On the other hand, since Christmas, this has become a major appliance never leaving the countertop and is used almost daily.
customer_reviews.author: ampwurx02

customer_reviews.title: Life saver!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a smart WiFi instant pot and we are very happy with it! I love that you can control and see the cooking status from the app. No issues setting up and connecting the instant pot to our WiFi. We made the best baby back ribs in 20 minutes! My wife just ordered the glass lid so we can use it as a slow cooker. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Will Hoppenrath

customer_reviews.title: Very handy dandy
customer_reviews.text: I like the ease of cooking and connecting to a smart device, it makes meal preparation much easier for a single person. The receipes could use work because when you type in certain ingrediants some of the items that show up do not use what I typed in.
customer_reviews.author: gneiss

customer_reviews.title: My go to cooking tool.
customer_reviews.text: I did have difficulty getting this instant pot to connect to my Wi-Fi. I’m quite sure how to do it my Wi-Fi set up, so don’t give up. I have two instant pots, this one and an 8 quart model . I love them both, and they tend to be my commonly used item in the kitchen I have two instant pots, this one and an 8 quart one. I love them both, and they tend to be like commonly used item in the kitchen
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Loving it so far! The app is cool, but I don’t Know if it’s necessarily worth the additional money. Great for checking times when you’re out of the room, but I guess it’s just an added bonus feature that I could live or live without. Other than that the pot is phenomenal, and we’re already digging into some really cool recipes. My best advice, save the money because you probably don’t need the remote app and Wi-Fi capabilities, but definitely get the pot.
customer_reviews.author: hotelguy26

customer_reviews.title: WiFi never works
customer_reviews.text: I called it dumb pot instead smart pot WiFi .. never connected to my WiFi , I have to waste my time of trying to make it work I really hope I don’t want to return just do it said in the website .. WiFi connection .. whatever
customer_reviews.author: Maganda at Gwapo

customer_reviews.title: Does it all
customer_reviews.text: Works as both a slow cooker and fast cooker, with many options for preparing rice, yogurt and more. Easy to set up, and includes several accessories.
customer_reviews.author: wyczguy

customer_reviews.title: The Pot works great but the app is never connected
customer_reviews.text: I like the pot, I have actually used it a lot for all kinds of foods and it works great every time. I haven't been able to connect the pot to my wifi using the App at all, don't waste any extra money on that feature.
customer_reviews.author: Byng4baby

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be a real improvement when cooking at high altitudes...
customer_reviews.text: We have found this to greatly speed up cooking time at an altitude of 7900' (in Colorado) where we were able to ckk a pot of black eyed peas in under an hour. When we tried to cook them on the stove it took hours and hours and we still didn't feel like they were totally done. This is a big improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Alison K.

customer_reviews.title: WiFi aspect unintuitive to the point of no value add
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing app. Unintuitive usage, both in the app and on the physical plastic buttons interface. Great suggestion of recipes and it seems like this type of product will provide great convenience, but there is no intuitive configuration of even simpler items like the time — and much less for integration with Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: hyliandanny

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE this IP
customer_reviews.text: This pot is AMAZING! I love the wifi option because I can start, stop and check on my pot. Easy to use and has totally changed the way I cook. I can't imagine my kitchen without it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Brosnan

customer_reviews.title: the worst product!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Instant pot is the worst product I've ever ordered from amazon. I waited more than a month. I paid about $ 224. I sent it Back when it burned. they returned me Small money. $ 2.46. which is impossible. I advise you not to buy instant pot, it does not have enough power and protection. its energy is very low. not safe for house hold.
customer_reviews.author: F.hussein

customer_reviews.title: A life changer!!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly delicious, fast meals for the whole family!!! If I can use it, anyone can!!!😂
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Best thing ever!
customer_reviews.text: The concept of being able to cook stew, beans or roast in 30-60 minutes is amazing! Without the app on your phone for setting time and changing settings it would be hard to understand. Sometimes I overcook things because I don’t see how the instructions could be correct but it is!! The only thing missing is a good instruction sheet/time settings for foods we cook everyday. Otherwise if you don’t have one of these that cook beans in 35m you have been wasting time!
customer_reviews.author: Greg & Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Don't get the wifi version.
customer_reviews.text: I love the instant pot but not the wifi. DON'T get the wifi version. I have to reset it with my devices every time. I stopped using the wifi feature
customer_reviews.author: honestypolice

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this WIFI one for our kitchen because the old one did not work well . It is a wonderful appliance to cook and you can setup time via WIFI to decide when it starts to cook . Love it
customer_reviews.author: Big buyer

customer_reviews.title: Quick cooking
customer_reviews.text: The product is really good for cooking various recipes. It saves a lot of time aswell. My only complaint is rice sticks to the bottom even after following all instructions and waiting for self release of pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Shreya Bukka

product_meta.title: Instant Pot Smart WiFi 8-in-1 Electric Pressure Cooker, Sterilizer, Slow Cooker, Rice Cooker, Steamer, Saute, Yogurt Maker, Cake Maker, and Warmer, 6 Quart, 13 One-Touch Programs
product_meta.description: The Instant Pot Smart Wi-Fi has arrived on the kitchen scene. The first multi-use programmable pressure cooker that can now be controlled and monitored with your mobile devices. Designed with a large display Screen, stainless steel cooking pot, 6 quart, 1000 watts. Not only will you experience meats cook faster, inexpensive cuts of meat become more tender with a melt-in your mouth Texture that few other cooking methods can replicate especially in less than an hour. You can now cook beans and lentils with no pre-soaking making last minute meal planning much easier. Even tough beans like chickpeas, and kidney beans can be prepared in approximately 30 minutes. How about chili or Irish stew prepared within an hour, risotto in 30 minutes, and best of all, with no stirring or watching over the dish as it cooks. Simply, monitor the progress of your meal from With your mobile device. Mobile devices, for Android 5. 0 or later and for iOS 9. 0 or later. Cooker requires 2. 4GHz Frequency band to operate with app.
feature_bullets: Cooks fast and saves time: The Instant Pot Smart Wifi combines 8 kitchen appliances in one: Pressure cooker, slow cooker, rice cooker, yogurt maker, cake maker, Saute pan, steamer, and warmer
Consistently delicious: 13 one-touch smart programs put cooking ribs, soups, beans, rice, poultry, yogurt, desserts and more on autopilot – with tasty results

Connected for ease of use: Compatible with Alexa and wifi - control your Instant Pot Smart Wifi in the palm of your hand with the Instant Pot app or through voice with Alexa. Includes access to 1,000+ pre-programmed recipes and verify cooking progress, share cooker access with family, and receive alerts on your mobile device
Accessories included: Stainless steel steam rack with handles, rice paddle, soup spoon, measuring cup and condensation collector. Power supply - 120V-60Hz
Advanced safety protection: The 10+ built-in safety features, including overheat protection, safety Lock and more to ensure safe pressure cooking

Plenty of recipes: Free Instant Pot app on iOS and Android devices is loaded with hundreds of recipes for any cuisine to get you started on your culinary adventure. Millions of users provide support and guidance in the many Instant Pot online communities
Most popular size capacity: 6-quart large capacity cooks for up to 6 people – perfect for families, and also great for meal prepping and batch cooking for singles and smaller households
Stainless steel inner pot: The Instant Pot stainless steel inner pot is made with a 3-ply bottom for durability and is healthy and dishwasher-safe

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,700 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
